channel.title: Vadim's Digital Garden
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Vadim's Digital Garden

item.title: 6 Sigma
item.description: Six Sigma is a data-driven methodology used to improve processes by identifying and eliminating defects, reducing variation, and increasing quality and efficiency.

item.title: 1. PM Foundations: Key Components
item.description: Enabling Decision-Making Foster a collaborative decision-making process by involving team members in setting goals and achieving deliverables.

item.title: PM Methodologies
item.description: Different program management methodologies Google PM guides Lean six sigma coggle.it/diagram/XdIfl65A3XR5G726/t/lean-six-sigma PM all about it PM overall mind map project-scheduling-and-tracking coggle.it/diagram/WGx7M5bCxOo_KASB/t/system-development-life-cycle-sdlc System-development-life-cycle-sdl...

item.title: SMART goals
item.description: Right goals for the right reasons Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant, and Time-bound.

item.title: 03_Project scope
item.description: Understanding Project Scope Project scope outlines the boundaries of a project, detailing what is included and excluded.

item.title: 04_Stake holders
item.description: Stakeholders - Who is invested in the project? - Who is impacted by this project? - Who contributes to this project? -Stakeholders and Resources Stakeholders: People interested in and affected by the project’s success, crucial for decision-making.

item.title: Project success
item.description: To measure the success of a product, consider including these metrics on your checklist: Track if you implemented the product’s priority requirements Track and assess the product’s number of technical issues or defects Measure the percentage of features you delivered or released at the end of the pr...

item.title: 06_RACI chart
item.description: RACI charts to define and communicate project team member responsibilities.

item.title: 7. Project fail because
item.description: unclear expectations unrealistic expectations conflict of stakeholders miscommunication lack of resources scope creep Lack of planning Siloed team Lack of leadership .
